com.stripe.stripepos

Class Terminal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stripe.stripepos.Terminal

  • public class Terminal
extends java.lang.Object
    The Terminal is the top-level object for the Stripe POS SDK.

                                    android.content.Context applicationContext)
        Initializes a terminal with the given API key and context.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The API key to use to connectReader to the Stripe API
        applicationContext - The Context of the running Android application
        Returns:
        The Terminal object that provides the main point of interaction with the reader and the Stripe API TODO (TERMINAL-2453): Add support for a TerminalListener TODO (TERMINAL-2454): Add support for TerminalConfiguration

      • cancelPaymentIntent

        public void cancelPaymentIntent(PaymentIntent intent,
                                PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Cancels a PaymentIntent. If the cancel request succeeds, the callback will be called with the updated PaymentIntent object with status CANCELED. If the cancel request fails, the callback will be called with an error.
        Parameters:
        intent - The PaymentIntent to be canceled
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback that should be called upon completion

      • clearConnectionToken

        public void clearConnectionToken()
        Clears the current connection token. You can use this method to switch accounts in your app, e.g. to switch between live and test Stripe API keys on your backend. In order to switch accounts in your app: - if a reader is connected, call disconnectReader(com.stripe.stripepos.ErrorCallback) - call clearConnectionToken() - call discoverReaders(com.stripe.stripepos.DiscoveryConfiguration, com.stripe.stripepos.DiscoveryListener, com.stripe.stripepos.ErrorCallback) and connectReader(com.stripe.stripepos.Reader, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderCallback) to connect to a reader. The connectReader(com.stripe.stripepos.Reader, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderCallback) call will request a new connection token from your backend server. An overview of the lifecycle of a connection token under the hood: - When a Terminal is initialized, the SDK attempts to proactively request a connection token from your backend server. - When connectReader(com.stripe.stripepos.Reader, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderCallback) is called, the SDK uses the connection token and reader information to create a reader session. - Subsequent calls to connectReader(com.stripe.stripepos.Reader, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderCallback) require a new connection token. If you disconnect from a reader, and then call connectReader(com.stripe.stripepos.Reader, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderCallback) again, the SDK will fetch another connection token.

      • collectPaymentMethod

        public Cancelable collectPaymentMethod(PaymentIntent intent,
                                       ReaderEventListener listener,
                                       PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Collects a payment method for the given PaymentIntent. If collecting a payment method fails, the callback will be called with an error. After resolving the error, you may call collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderEventListener, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback) again to either try the same card again, or try a different card. If collecting a payment method succeeds, the callback will be called with a PaymentIntent with status REQUIRES_CONFIRMATION, indicating that you should call confirmPaymentIntent(com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback) to finish the payment.
        Parameters:
        intent - The PaymentIntent to which the source should be attached
        listener - The ReaderEventListener to alert when reader events are triggered
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback to be called after the command completes
        Returns:
        A Cancelable that allows the operation to be canceled at any time

      • confirmPaymentIntent

        public void confirmPaymentIntent(PaymentIntent intent,
                                 PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Confirms a PaymentIntent. Call this immediately after receiving a PaymentIntent from collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderEventListener, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback). When confirming a PaymentIntent fails, the SDK returns an error that includes the updated PaymentIntent. Your app should inspect the updated PaymentIntent to decide how to retry the payment. If the updated PaymentIntent is null, the request to Stripe's servers timed out and the PaymentIntent's status is unknown. We recommend that you retry confirming the original PaymentIntent. If you instead choose to abandon the original PaymentIntent and create a new one, do not capture the original PaymentIntent. If you do, you might charge your customer twice. If the updated PaymentIntent's status is still REQUIRES_CONFIRMATION (e.g., the request failed because your app is not connected to the internet), you can call confirmPaymentIntent(com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback) again with the updated PaymentIntent to retry the request. If the updated PaymentIntent's status changes to REQUIRES_SOURCE (e.g., the request failed because the card was declined), call collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderEventListener, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback) with the updated PaymentIntent to try charging another card. If confirming the PaymentIntent succeeds, the callback will be called with a PaymentIntent object with status REQUIRES_CAPTURE, Stripe Terminal uses two-step card payments to prevent unintended and duplicate payments. When the SDK returns a confirmed PaymentIntent to your app, a charge has been authorized but not yet settled, or captured. On your backend, capture the confirmed PaymentIntent.
        Parameters:
        intent - The PaymentIntent to confirm
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback to be called when confirmation completes

      • connectReader

        public void connectReader(Reader reader,
                          ReaderCallback connectionCallback)
        Attempts to connect to the given reader. TODO (TERMINAL-2417): Update this after adding connectionStatus If the connect succeeds, the callback will be called with the connected reader, and the terminal's `connectionStatus` will change to `Connected`. If the connect fails, the callback will be called with an error. TODO (TERMINAL-2418): Update this after implementing connection tokens Under the hood, the SDK uses the `fetchConnectionToken` method you defined to fetch a connection token if it does not already have one. It then uses the connection token and reader information to create a reader session.
        Parameters:
        reader - The Reader object to connect to.
        connectionCallback - The callback to be called when connection completes

      • createPaymentIntent

        public void createPaymentIntent(PaymentParameters params,
                                PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Creates a new PaymentIntent with the given parameters. Note: If the information required to create a PaymentIntent isn't readily available in your app, you can create the PaymentIntent on your server and use the retrievePaymentIntent(java.lang.String, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback) method to retrieve the PaymentIntent in your app.
        Parameters:
        params - The PaymentParameters object with info about the intent to create
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback to be called when creation completes

      • disconnectReader

        public void disconnectReader(ErrorCallback callback)
        Attempts to disconnect from the currently connected reader. If the disconnect succeeds, the callback is called with null. If the disconnect fails, the callback is called with an error.
        Parameters:
        callback - The ErrorCallback that should be called after disconnection.

      • discoverReaders

        public Cancelable discoverReaders(DiscoveryConfiguration config,
                                  DiscoveryListener discoveryListener,
                                  ErrorCallback callback)
        Begins discovering readers matching the given DiscoveryConfiguration. When discoverReaders is called, the terminal begins scanning for readers using the settings in the given DiscoveryConfiguration. You must implement DiscoveryListener to handle displaying discovery results to your user and connecting to a selected reader. The discovery process will stop on its own when the terminal successfully connects to a reader, if the command is canceled, or if an error occurs. If the discovery process completes successfully, or if an error occurs, the ErrorCallback will be called to notify that the operation is complete. To end discovery after a specified time interval, set the timeout property on your DiscoveryConfiguration. Be sure to either set a timeout, or make it possible to cancel discover in your app's UI.
        Parameters:
        config - The DiscoveryConfiguration to be used for discovery
        discoveryListener - The DiscoveryListener that should be notified whenever a set of Readers is found for connection.
        callback - The ErrorCallback that should be called after discover has completed.
        Returns:
        A Cancelable that allows the operation to be canceled at any time.

      • readSource

        public Cancelable readSource()
        Reads a payment method with the given parameters and returns a Stripe source. Note that sources created using this method cannot be charged. Use collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripepos.ReaderEventListener, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback) and confirmPaymentIntent(com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripepos.PaymentIntentCallback) if you are collecting a payment from a customer. Use this method to read payment details without charging the customer. If reading a source fails, the callback will be called with an error containing details about the failure. If reading a source succeeds, the callback will be called with a CardPresentSource. You should send the ID of the source to your backend for further processing. For example, you can use source's fingerprint to look up a charge created using the same card. TODO (TERMINAL-2421): Add params (Parameters object, listener, and callback)

      • retrievePaymentIntent

        public void retrievePaymentIntent(java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                  PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Retrieves a PaymentIntent with a client secret. If the information required to create a PaymentIntent isn't readily available in your app, you can create the PaymentIntent on your server and use this method to retrieve the PaymentIntent in your app.
        Parameters:
        clientSecret - The client secret of the PaymentIntent to be retrieved
        callback - The callback to be called when retrieval completes
        See Also:
        retrieve_payment_intent

      • updateReaderSoftware

        public void updateReaderSoftware(ErrorCallback callback)
        Checks for a reader update and prompts your app to begin installing the update. If an update is available, the callback will be called with null, the listener's readerUpdateAvailable method will be called, and you will have the opportunity to either begin or cancel the update. If no update is available, or an error occurs checking for an update, the callback will be called with an error. TODO (TERMINAL-2423): Add listener param
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be called when checking for an update completes.

      • getConnectedReader

        public Reader getConnectedReader()
        Returns:
        The Reader that is currently connected or null if no reader is connected
